update

public void update()
Updates the local Configuration Cache. Note that this cache will never be out of sync if all Robot configuration is sensorUpdated through the ConfigurationControl

setPersistentFlagDefaults

public void setPersistentFlagDefaults()
Reverts to default persistent flags
  • Prevent Sleep In Charger = Off
  • Enable Vector Drive = On
  • Disable Self Level In Charger = Off
  • Enable Persistent Tail Light = Off
  • Enable Motion Timeout = Off

isPersistentFlagEnabled

Check if persistent flag is enabled

Parameters:
flag - the persistent flag to check
Returns:
true if flag is enabled, false if disabled

setRotationRate

public void setRotationRate(float rate)
Control the rotation rate that Sphero will use to meet new heading commands. A lower value offers better control but with a larger turning radius. A higher value will yield quick turns but Sphero may roll over on itself and lose control.

The commanded value is a scale of the maximum rate (currently 400 degrees/sec). So, setting a value of 0.8 will set the rotation rate to 320 degrees/sec. A value of zero doesn't make much sense so it's interpreted as 0.784, the minimum.

setHeading

public void setHeading(float heading)
Adjust the orientation of Sphero by commanding a new reference heading in degrees, which ranges from 0 to 359. You will see the ball respond immediately to this command if stabilization is enabled.

Using this command along with Sphero.setBackLEDBrightness(float) and Sphero.drive(float, float) with velocity 0, you can write code that allows a user to aim Spheroâ„¢ in a forward direction relative to them, and set that as the 0 degree heading.

enableInactivityTimeout

public void enableInactivityTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
To save battery power, Sphero normally goes to sleep after a period of inactivity. From the factory this value is set to 600 seconds (10 minutes) but this API command can alter it to any value of 60 seconds or greater.

The inactivity timer is reset every time an API command is received over Bluetooth or a shell command is executed in User Hack mode. In addition, the timer is continually reset when a macro is running unless the MF_STEALTH flag is set, and the same for orbBasic unless the BF_STEALTH flag is set.

enableMotionTimeout

public void enableMotionTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
This class encapsulates a way to set the ultimate timeout for the last motion command to keep Sphero from rolling away in the case of a crashed (or paused) client app. The timeBeforeTimeout parameter is expressed in milliseconds and default to 2000 upon wake-up.

If the control system is enabled, the timeout triggers a stop otherwise it commands zero PWM to both motors. This "termination behavior" is inhibited if a macro is running with the flag MF_EXCLUSIVE_DRV set, or an orbBasic program is executing with a similar flag, BF_EXCLUSIVE_DRV.

disableMotionTimeout

public void disableMotionTimeout()
Disables the motion timeout in the persistent option flags
